intro: Ornithocephalus escobarianus, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking orange to red tubular flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Ornithocephalus escobarianus is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
